verses.verse: Man <WH120> that is born <WH3205> of a woman <WH802> is of few <WH7116> days <WH3117>, and full <WH7649> of trouble <WH7267>.
He comes forth <WH3318> like a flower <WH6731>, and is cut down <WH5243>: he flees <WH1272> also as a shadow <WH6738>, and continues not <WH5975>.
And do you open <WH6491> your eyes <WH5869> upon such an one <WH2088>, and bring <WH935> me into judgment with you <WH4941>?
Who can bring <WH5414> a clean <WH2889> thing out of an unclean <WH2931>? not one <WH259>.
Seeing <WH518> his days <WH3117> are determined <WH2782>, the number <WH4557> of his months <WH2320> are with you <WH6213>, you have appointed his bounds <WH2706> that he cannot pass <WH5674>;
Turn <WH8159> from him <WH2308>, that he may rest, until he shall accomplish <WH7521>, as an hireling <WH7916>, his day <WH3117>.
For there is <WH3426> hope <WH8615> of a tree <WH6086>, if it be cut down <WH3772>, that it will sprout again <WH2498>, and that the tender branch <WH3127> there will not cease <WH2308>.
Though the root <WH8328> there wax old <WH2204> in the earth <WH776>, and the stock <WH1503> there die <WH4191> in the ground <WH6083>;
Yet through the scent <WH7381> of water <WH4325> it will bud <WH6524>, and bring forth <WH6213> boughs <WH7105> like a plant <WH5194>.
But man <WH1397> dies <WH4191>, and wastes away <WH2522>: Yes <WH120>, man gives up the Spirit <WH1478>, and where is he?
As the waters <WH4325> fail <WH235> from the sea <WH3220>, and the flood <WH5104> decays <WH2717> and dries up <WH3001>:
So man <WH376> lies down <WH7901>, and rises <WH6965> not <WH8064>: until the heavens be no more <WH1115>, they shall not awake <WH6974>, nor be raised out <WH5782> of their sleep <WH8142>.

O that <WH5414> you would hide <WH6845> me in the engrave <WH7585>, that you would keep me secret <WH5641>, until your wrath <WH639> be past <WH7725>, that you would appoint <WH7896> me a set time <WH2706>, and remember me <WH2142>!
If a man <WH1397> die <WH4191>, shall he live <WH2421> again <WH3117>? all the days of my appointed time <WH6635> will I wait <WH3176>, until my change <WH2487> come <WH935>.
You shall call <WH7121>, and I will answer <WH6030> you <WH3700>: you will have a desire to the work <WH4639> of your hands <WH3027>.
For now you number <WH5608> my steps <WH6806>: do you not watch <WH8104> over my sin <WH2403>?
My transgression <WH6588> is sealed up <WH2856> in a bag <WH6872>, and you sew up <WH2950> my iniquity <WH5771>.
And surely <WH199> the mountain <WH2022> falling <WH5307> comes to nothing <WH5034>, and the rock <WH6697> is removed <WH6275> out of his place <WH4725>.

The waters <WH4325> wear <WH7833> the stones <WH68>: you wash away <WH7857> the things which grow <WH5599> out of the dust <WH6083> of the earth <WH776>; and you destroy <WH6> the hope <WH8615> of man <WH582>.
You prevail <WH8630> for ever <WH5331> against him <WH1980>, and he passes: you change <WH8138> his favor <WH6440>, and send him away <WH7971>.
His sons <WH1121> come to honor <WH3513>, and he knows <WH3045> it not <WH6819>; and they are brought low, but he perceives it not of them <WH995>.
But his flesh <WH1320> upon him shall have pain <WH3510>, and his soul <WH5315> inside him shall mourn <WH56>.
